name: hloml

stmt.origin: simp1d(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, coml), wcel(c0, ccla), wcel(c0, clc))
stmt.pretty: simp1d(c0 ∈ HL, c0 ∈ OML, c0 ∈ CLat, c0 ∈ CvLat)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, coml))
-| wi(wcel(c0, chlt), w3a(wcel(c0, coml), wcel(c0, ccla), wcel(c0, clc)))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ HL → c0 ∈ OML)
⊣ (c0 ∈ HL →(c0 ∈ OML ∧ c0 ∈ CLat ∧ c0 ∈ CvLat))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c0, coml))
-| wi(wcel(c0, chlt), w3a(wcel(c0, coml), wcel(c0, ccla), wcel(c0, clc)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ HL → c0 ∈ OML)
⊣ (c0 ∈ HL →(c0 ∈ OML ∧ c0 ∈ CLat ∧ c0 ∈ CvLat))

body.origin: |- wi(wcel(c0, chlt), w3a(wcel(c0, coml), wcel(c0, ccla), wcel(c0, clc)))
body.pretty: ⊢ (c0 ∈ HL →(c0 ∈ OML ∧ c0 ∈ CLat ∧ c0 ∈ CvLat))

comment: A Hilbert lattice is orthomodular. (Contributed by NM, 20-Oct-2011.)
